member.name: T:Atom.Design.IObjectPropertyWrapper
member.summary: Exposes the properties of an by wrapping around it, adding additional behaviour and metadata.
member.remarks:
An object property wrapper is used to extend the properties of an existing object. This is useful when an object is supposed to be bound to a PropertyGrid.
By binding the PropertyGrid to an IObjectPropertyWrapper instead of an actual Object one can easily add metadata (such as DisplayNameAttribute, DescriptionAttribute, EditorAttribute, ..), additional behaviour, and choose exactly what properties to expose to the PropertyGrid.
This also pulls all design-time related metadata, away from the object, to the IObjectPropertyWrapper.
